result.execSummary:
The defendant James M. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James M. Miller in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant James M. Miller in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF405, 14CF120 (sentencing hearing) and 14CF408 (Preliminary Hearing, Plea Hearing and Sentencing Hearing all heard today).

1:36 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

14CF408:
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial in Branch 1.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No Contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Count's 2 & 3 are DRI on case 14CF408.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date on 14CF408.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Knaapen does not have any corrections to the PSI.
Atty Sheets does not have any corrections to the PSI.
Atty Knaapen states that 14CF120 had been plead to but is not listed on face sheet of PSI.
Atty Sheets references Page 6 on the PSI as stated on the record.
Court makes changes on his copy of the PSI.
Neither party will be providing any evidence.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Court interrupts and states that Pre-Trial Supervision Report had been provided; State has received a copy and makes statements that the date is incorrect.
Atty Sheets has received his copy of the Pre-Trial Supervison Report also.
Atty Knaapen provides the Court with his copy of the Pre-Trial Supervison Report.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets  makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements on his behalf prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
13CF405:
Count 1 -
Impose 5.5 year prison sentence with 2 years 6 months initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision
Not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.
Participate in Sex Offender Program as deemed appropriate
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Comply with continued alcohol and drug treatment 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Pay Fine of $1,200.00 + applicable costs
Pay $26.45 for Blood Draw
Pay DNA Surcharge
36 months DL Revocation
36 month IID effective today's date
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain/Obtain full-time employment.
Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan
**cash bond to be applied to fines/costs.

Count 2 - Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion

14CF120:
Count 1 -
Serve 6 months in County Jail conccurent with 13CF405
Pay fine of $500.00 + applicable costs
Pay DNA Surcharge 
Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan
**cash bond to be applied to fines/costs

14CF408:
Count 1 -
Serve 6 months in the County Jail concurrent with 13CF405 and 14CF120
Pay costs

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

**21 days jail credit on all 3 files.
Status conference on January 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *7 times per week
Bond must be posted in full, cannot be done thru a wage assignment.

Defendant James M. Miller appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Louis J. Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Molepske makes statements to the Court. 
Court reviews the file.  Questions the defendant. 
Defendant makes statements.  Defendant missed his court date because he was at work.  Was unaware that he was supposed to be in Court. 

Atty Molepske makes additional statements.  Recommends a $1,500 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.
Court questions defendant further.  Status conference scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eric Sheets in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:38 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.
Atty Knaapen files information.

Atty Sheets addresses the Court, is trying to contact his client, requests this case be re-called at 10:30.

State has no objection.

BY THE COURT:
Court will re-call this case.

10:57 AM Court re-calls this case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.
Defendant still does not appear.
Atty Sheets does appear.

Atty Sheets does not know where his client is, guessing that he is at work. 
Defendant does not answer his phone when he's at work.
Atty Sheets was expecting his client to be here.

Court reviews ATTIC report.
Atty Sheets addresses the Court regarding the report.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, requests a bench warrant for failure to appear.

Atty Sheets requests matter to be continued for one week.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a bench warrant for arrest.

Defendant James M. Miller in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Atty Sheets makes statements re: waiver of preliminary hearing, arraignment and ptc be set. 

Atty Constable asks for the bond to be continued. 

BY THE COURT: Bond Continued. 

**Clerk notes no bond was set**
1:52 pm.  Court informs Atty Constable bond was not set.  Atty Sheets and the defendant are not present at this time.  Arraignment scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eric Sheets in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not present today.  Atty Sheets thinks his client may have thought his court date was another date with his other cases.  No objection.  BTC:  Matter adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
